Sunnyvale School District Food Services will be transitioning to free meals for anyone under age 18 beginning Wednesday, Sept. 9.

Free breakfast and lunch and frozen dinner meals will be available at Bishop, Columbia Middle, Lakewood, and San Miguel, Monday through Friday from 10:30 a.m. to 1:30 p.m. and from 10:30 a.m. to 2 p.m. at Vargas. Ellis will offer a breakfast, lunch, and snack bundle from 10:30-1:30 p.m.

Anyone under 18 can pick up meals free of cost from any of these sites.
-No student ID required.
-Students do not need to be present.
-All meals are free regardless of eligibility.
-Menus are posted on the district website under Child Nutrition

County of Santa Clara Public Health Department
May 26 at 5:00 PM ·

New pop-up COVID-19 testing locations are available this week: ⁣⁣
⁣ ⁣⁣
Wednesday, May 27, 9 am– 1 pm ⁣⁣
Rengstorff Park Pool Area, 201 S Rengstorff Ave., Mountain View, CA 94040 ⁣⁣
⁣⁣
Friday, May 29, 10 am– 2 pm ⁣⁣
Tropicana Foods Shopping Center parking lot, 1630 Story Rd, San Jose, CA 95122 ⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
Getting tested at one of these sites is completely free! Health insurance is not required. You don’t need a doctor’s note, either. ⁣⁣
⁣⁣
The tests offered at these sites are viral detection tests, which diagnose a person who currently has an infection. Read more about the different types of COVID-19 tests: http://www.sccgov.org/sites/covid19/Pages/covid19-testing-learn-more.aspx#types ⁣⁣
⁣⁣
Workers with regular interaction with the public should get tested once a month. This includes grocery store clerks, food delivery workers, retail associates, first responders, and many other types of workers. It is recommended that these workers get tested even if they have no symptoms at all. ⁣⁣
⁣⁣
For additional information on where to get testing, visit www.sccfreetest.org or call 2-1-1.

At Bishop, we believe that everyone has genius and can contribute to our school's greatness. As one of the South Bay’s first Leader in Me schools, we focus on continuous improvement by teaching leadership to every student and creating a culture of student empowerment. Our goal is to empower every child with the leadership and life skills they need to succeed.

At Bishop, students develop habits for lifelong success. They have a voice and they know their opinions and contributions add value. Students learn that they matter to our school community as well as in the world. They understand that they can inspire positive action in themselves and in others. Great happens here.

Congratulations to the 16 families at Ellis Elementary School for graduating from a free 6-week digital literacy course made possible thanks to a $313,000 grant from the California Public Utilities Commission and a $100,000 grant from @GoogleInCA! They were gifted Chrome laptops to take home too!

The group of 16 families is the first of 650 families anticipated to benefit from the program over the next two years. Other Sunnyvale School District schools that will benefit include Bishop Elementary, Columbia Middle, Lakewood Elementary, San Miguel Elementary and Vargas Elementary.

The goal of the program is to increase access to and understanding of technology. Thank you to the Columbia Neighborhood Center for implementing the program and thank you to Larry Klein, Sunnyvale Mayor for attending! #ClosingTheDigitalDivide

Thanks @LinkedIn and @StartingArts for giving our students the opportunity to create and display art in LinkedIn's Sunnyvale offices! The partnership was created to provide engaging design-thinking programs that show art and design are everywhere! LinkedIn hosted an art show event on October 18 where employees could meet the young artists and their families at the 1101 Maude Avenue location in Sunnyvale.

post_text: Drop! Cover! And hold on! The entire Sunnyvale School District including the District Office participated in the Great @ShakeOut on the 30th anniversary of the Loma Prieta quake today to practice how to respond in the event of an earthquake. Each school in the Sunnyvale School District has a comprehensive earthquake emergency procedure system in place and a full evacuation plan. Each year a comprehensive school safety plan is evaluated and amended, as needed, by a school safety planning committee. To ensure a comprehensive safety plan is properly implemented, schools perform regular safety drills monthly. It's always important to #BePrepared. #ShakeOut #ShakeOut2019 #WeAreSunnyvaleSD

Calling all Middle School Families!

The City of Cupertino Safe Routes to Schools is pleased to announce their newest summer program: a workshop for middle schoolers and their parent/guardian called Middle School Bike Skills! The program is open to all students regardless of City of residence. This half-day workshop, offered by their partner Wheel Kids, will prepare your rising 6th, 7th or 8th grader to get to middle school and beyond. You and your student will both learn how to be a safe and predictable rider, then practice important bike handling skills before going out on a group bike ride to put all these new skills to use.

To register, go directly to the registration page:

http://wheelkids.com/msbs-cupertino/
